The biggest reason writing an essay is so hard is because we mostly focus on those external rewards like getting a passing grade or our teacher's approval. The problem is that when you focus on external approval it not only makes writing much less fun, it also makes it significantly harder. How do you write an essay when you're stuck? Do not panic. How to Find Motivation to Do Your Assignment Write down the reasons and consequences of why you have to do this task. ...Try to indulge yourself for a well done work. ...Take a break to refresh your organism. ...Make your working environment comfortable. ...Find a person that inspires you. ...Force yourself to do nothing.

If you really don’t want to write a particular paper, let others write it and you put together the pieces (always citing the work of others). Here’s how I did it. 1) Identify a few other key papers related to the subject of the paper I have been assigned. 2) Skim those papers, copying (and keeping the references) parts that apply and pasting into my document. 3) Go over my paper full of quotes from other papers, rearranging and summarizing the quotes. I add a little text to pull them all together. I always end up with a few ideas of my own that I throw in. My new ideas sometimes mean that I look up more source material, but that’s OK. 4) Edit a bit to make sure it’s reasonably clean and polished (and that the citations are present and correct). You’ll never have enough time to make it perfect. 5) Add my cover page / heading as appropriate and submit. That strategy got me a 4.something GPA on my master’s just a few years ago.
